movies.title: Astérix et le coup du menhir
movies.plot: When the druid Panoramix is attacked by some roman soldiers, Obelix drives them away by throwing a menhir on them - which accidentally hits Panoramix. After this the druid has lost his memory and can not remember the formula of his magic potions, especially the one which gives superhuman strength.
movies.simplePlot: The druid is accidentally hit by a menhir thrown by Obelix and loses his mind and memory.

biography.bio: Roger Carel was born on August 14, 1927 in Paris, France as Roger Bancharel. He is known for his work on The Twelve Tasks of Asterix (1976), Asterix and Cleopatra (1968) and Asterix the Gaul (1967).
biography.name: Roger Carel

biography.bio: Pierre Tornade began his film career playing his first role in Lock Up Your Spoons (1957). He then had supporting roles in many famous French films like The Troops in New York (1965) and The Restaurant (1966), both featuring Louis de Funès, I Don't Know Much, But I'll Say Everything (1973) directed by Pierre Richard and also featuring him, and Mais où est donc passée la 7ème compagnie (1973). Pierre Tornade is mostly well known for voicing several characters in many animated films and series. These include Vitalstatistix in Asterix films Asterix the Gaul (1967), Asterix and Cleopatra (1968) and The Twelve Tasks of Asterix (1976), Obelix in Astérix et la surprise de César (1985), Astérix chez les Bretons (1986), Astérix et le coup du menhir (1989) and Asterix in America (1994), and Averell Dalton in Lucky Luke films Lucky Luke (1971), Lucky Luke: Ballad of the Daltons (1978) and Les Dalton en cavale (1983).
biography.name: Pierre Tornade

biography.bio: Henri Labussière was born on March 20, 1921 in Villeneuve-Saint-Georges, Val-de-Marne, France. He was an actor and writer, known for Les aventures de Tintin (1991), The Twelve Tasks of Asterix (1976) and Astérix et le coup du menhir (1989). He died on June 15, 2008 in Paris, France.
biography.name: Henri Labussière

biography.bio: Passionate about acting, Julien Guiomar has left a lasting imprint on the theater (since 1952), on television (since 1958) and on the big screen (since 1966) in a career spanning five decades. And yet, Guiomar first saw himself as a dentist, ... like Daddy! But he finally proved the saying 'Like father like song' wrong. Too bad for dentistry but so much the better for entertainment which otherwise would have had to do without his singular talent. And, to tell the truth, Julien Guiomar did not coddle himself. He indeed appeared in over thirty plays with Jean Vilar's famed Théâtre National Populaire (TNP); he was in more than forty TV films, in which his incredible presence allowed him to embody such figures as Alexandre Borgia or Diafoirus in Molière's Le malade imaginaire (1971). His film parts are even more numerous and include authority figures (colonels, police commissioners, prelates and even God Himself in Arthur Joffé's curious comedy Let There Be Light (1998). As of his first two appearances, in Philippe de Broca's King of Hearts (1966), as a lunatic who takes himself for a bishop and in Louis Malle's The Thief of Paris (1967) as a phony priest, Julien Guiomar has imposed an image of authority tinged with eccentricity. Always colorful in his expression, he can also exert sheer spitefulness (the colonel in Costa-Gavras Z (1969)) or warm humanity (the surgeon of Serge Korber's Je vous ferai aimer la vie (1979)). He may have been in too many campy comedies but he saves them from total crassness by his mere inspired presence. Julien Guiomar retired in 2004 after a final TV Film.
biography.name: Julien Guiomar

biography.bio: Henri Poirier was born on March 21, 1932 in Colombes, Hauts-de-Seine, France. He was an actor, known for Les Fargeot (1974), Murmur of the Heart (1971) and The Twelve Tasks of Asterix (1976). He died on February 8, 2005 in Le Blanc-Mesnil, Seine-Saint-Denis, France.
biography.name: Henri Poirier

biography.bio: Marie-Anne Chazel was born on September 19, 1951 in Gap, Hautes-Alpes, France. She is an actress and writer, known for Les visiteurs (1993), Le père Noël est une ordure (1982) and Les bronzés font du ski (1979). She was previously married to Christian Clavier.
biography.name: Marie-Anne Chazel

biography.bio: Roger Lumont was born on February 21, 1934 in Les Lilas, Seine-Saint-Denis, France. He is an actor, known for The Twelve Tasks of Asterix (1976), Astérix chez les Bretons (1986) and Astérix et la surprise de César (1985).
biography.name: Roger Lumont

biography.bio: Patrick Préjean was born on June 4, 1944 in Saint-Maur-des-Fossés, Val-de-Marne, France. He is known for his work on My Mother's Castle (1990), Space Goofs (1997) and Astérix et le coup du menhir (1989).
biography.name: Patrick Préjean

biography.bio: Edgar Givry was born on August 9, 1953. He is an actor, known for The Dinner Game (1998), Rahan - Fils des âges farouches (1987) and Le placard (2001).
biography.name: Edgar Givry

biography.bio: Jean-Jacques Cramier is an actor, known for Astérix et le coup du menhir (1989).
biography.name: Jean-Jacques Cramier

biography.bio: Yves Barsacq was born on June 17, 1931 in Paris, France. He is known for his work on Les aventures de Tintin (1991), Love and Death (1975) and Fantastic Planet (1973). He died on October 4, 2015 in Albenga, Liguria, Italy.
biography.name: Yves Barsacq

biography.bio: Gérard Croce is an actor and producer, known for Germinal (1993), Astérix chez les Bretons (1986) and Astérix et la surprise de César (1985).
biography.name: Gérard Croce

biography.bio: Jean Francois Aupied is an actor, known for Astérix et le coup du menhir (1989), SSX Tricky (2001) and La méridienne (1988).
biography.name: Jean Francois Aupied

biography.bio: Christine Aurel is an actress, known for Astérix et le coup du menhir (1989), Hitler's Last Train (1977) and Donkey Skin (1970).
biography.name: Christine Aurel

biography.bio: Paul Bisciglia was born on July 30, 1928 in Algiers, Alger, France. He was an actor, known for Astérix chez les Bretons (1986), Before the Deluge (1954) and The Mad Adventures of 'Rabbi' Jacob (1973). He died on April 18, 2010 in Nanterre, Hauts-de-Seine, France.
biography.name: Paul Bisciglia
